alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 10:40AM CST until February 04 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for a portion of the following river in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River, from Lafayette downstream to Riverton. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is low potential for flooding to develop during the second half of the week of January 28 at Vincennes. The river is rising at all locations south of Lafayette. Flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop during ice break up, but this threat is diminishing due to the amount of time air temperatures are spending above the freezing mark. River levels on the White River at Elliston, Edwardsport, Petersburg, and Hazleton will be monitored for possible upcoming flood warnings. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 4... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...Until Sunday, February 4. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Wabash River extends to Interstate 70 Mile Marker Number 4 from its west bank in the Terre Haute and West Terre Haute area. All lakes in this area are affected by seep water and reach capacity with some minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Saturday /9:30 AM CST Saturday/ the stage was 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Saturday /9:30 AM CST Saturday/ was 18.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday, February 3. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 545 AM EST /445 AM CST/.
